To produce graduates with the ability to apply business computer networks knowledge, skills, techniques and tools to create best-possible solutions to complex ICT problems.
To train students with skills necessary to facilitate the acquisition, adoption and adaptation of ICT knowledge, techniques and tools to improve business performance.
To train graduates who are innovative and creative, who possess good problem-solving skills and are capable of life-long learning.
To produce all-rounded graduates with demonstrable ethical and professional behaviour, and who possess effective communication, management, entrepreneurial and interpersonal skills.
To train and equip students with the capability to pursue postgraduate studies.
fields.general_prerequisites:
Have at least a mean grade of C+ in Kenya Certificate of Secondary Education (KCSE).
In addition, candidates are expected to have at least a grade C- or above in Mathematics, Physics, or Physical Science.
Have two principal passes in science subject in KACE and at least a credit in a pass in Mathematics.
Have a Higher Diploma or Diploma in IT or any other related discipline from a recognized university or college.
Have a degree from a recognized University.

fields.course_name: Bachelor of Science (Information Technology)
fields.course_objectives:
This Bachelor of Science in Information Technology program aims to meet society’s demands for ICT solutions and prepare a generation of highly skilled specialists in the field. The developments in this area create opportunities for you to utilize the knowledge gained in the program for either an international career or further master's level studies.

By pursuing this course you will learn how to develop, maintain, and manage computer and network systems in organizations. You will be equipped with practical skills in managing operating systems, designing software, analyzing systems, building network applications, and programming. This program will prepare you to understand the challenges and opportunities that come with a technology industry that is constantly developing and changing. By the end of this program, you will be able to provide IT solutions based on new and emerging technologies to organizations and communities that utilize information technology.

By the end of the course, the graduate should be able to:

Have the ability to use industry-standard computer software and hardware.
Get equipped with problem-solving skills and can adapt to a fast-changing technological world.
Analyze problems, and provide solutions to IT-based problems.
Assist in system administration and networking in areas such as product research, consultancy, and education. 
Apply knowledge of Computing and Mathematics appropriate to the discipline.
Effectively communicate information, ideas, problems, and IT-based solutions.
Analyze the local and global impact of computing on individuals, organizations, and society.
Demonstrate professionalism, ethics, legal, security, and social responsibilities as well as best practices and standards and their application in IT fields.
Progress academically to higher levels of education into relevant degree courses.
fields.course_general_info_and_about:
The Bachelor of Science in Information Technology (B.Sc IT) degree program provides theoretical understanding and technical expertise in developing and managing an organization’s technical resources. The program is focused on subjects such as software, databases, and networking.

In today's world, people are highly dependent on Information and Communication Technology (ICT). ICT includes the digitalization of human communication and affects everyone's lives, as well as industries, companies, government agencies, and NGOs. New IT systems and services are continually evolving, and people and products are becoming increasingly connected, which leads to a greater demand for information technology experts in the job market.

This BSc Information Technology program gives you a combination of knowledge about hardware, software, computer science, and communications technology. The program also integrates technology with economics, leadership, and sustainable development, giving you a broad perspective on technological development. 

Employment and output in computer systems design and related services are projected to grow rapidly over the next decade, outpacing similar professional, scientific, and technical industries and the economy as a whole. The BSc in Information Technology degree provides theoretical understanding and technical expertise in developing and managing an organization’s technical resources. These resources include logical, physical, human, and financial resources. Subject areas covered include cybersecurity, computer forensics, networks, and operating systems, project management, and management of information technology. The knowledge acquired by Information Technology graduates allows them to pursue careers as:

Computer and Information Systems Managers
Computer Systems Analysts
Database Administrators
Network and Computer Systems Administrators
Management Analysts
This BSc in Information Technology program is recommended for those who enjoy working on computers and keeping up with the latest advances in technology. IT professionals who would like to build on their skills and knowledge in this field are invited to apply. It is also suitable for high school graduates who are interested in pursuing an IT-based career.
fields.general_prerequisites:
KCSE candidates with a mean grade of C+ and C or above in Mathematics.
Be a holder of a KACE certificate with a minimum of two principal passes and one subsidiary pass at A-level, and a minimum of a principal pass in Mathematics or Physics with a credit pass in mathematics at O-level.
Accredited Diploma in Information Technology or related field with a credit pass.

fields.course_name: Bachelor of Science (Computer Science)
fields.course_objectives:
The B.S. in Computer Science students receive:

Comprehensive understanding of design, development, testing, and documentation of a range of operating systems.
Comprehensive knowledge in database management and programming languages.
Essential knowledge to help them in implementing the skills acquired in class into real-life situations.
An ability to apply knowledge of computing and mathematics appropriate to the program’s student outcomes and to the discipline.
Adequate skills to help them design, implement, and evaluate a computer-based system, process, component, or program to meet desired needs.
An ability to function effectively on teams to accomplish a common goal.
An understanding of professional, ethical, legal, security and social issues and responsibilities.
An ability to communicate effectively with a range of audiences.
An ability to analyze the local and global impact of computing on individuals, organizations, and society.
Recognition of the need for and an ability to engage in continuing professional development.
An ability to use current techniques, skills, and tools necessary for computing practice.
An ability to apply mathematical foundations, algorithmic principles, and computer science theory in the modeling and design of computer-based systems in a way that demonstrates comprehension of the tradeoffs involved in design choices.
An ability to apply design and development principles in the construction of software systems of varying complexity.
Upon successful completion of a BSc Computer Science degree program, students will be able to:

Demonstrate proficiency in problem-solving techniques using the computer.
Demonstrate proficiency in at least two high-level programming languages and two operating systems.
Demonstrate proficiency in the analysis of complex problems and the synthesis of solutions to those problems.
Demonstrate comprehension of modern software engineering principles.
Demonstrate a breadth and depth of knowledge in the discipline of computer science.
fields.course_general_info_and_about:
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science program is a university degree program that involves the study of computing concepts and theories, algorithmic foundations, and new developments in computing. The program prepares students to design and create algorithmically complex software and develop new and effective algorithms for solving computing problems. Computer science degree students learn the theoretical foundations of information and computation, taking a scientific and practical approach to computation and its applications. 

Computer science is considered by many of its practitioners to be a foundational science that makes other knowledge and achievements possible. The study of computer science involves systematically studying methodical processes (such as algorithms) in order to aid the acquisition, representation, processing, storage, communication of, and access to information. This is done by analyzing the feasibility, structure, expression, and mechanization of these processes and how they relate to this information. In computer science, the term ‘information’ refers usually to information that is encoded in bits and bytes in computer memory.

Computer science incorporates a number of specialist areas underpinning the digital technologies we use every day. You will learn the main areas of the discipline, including software engineering, artificial intelligence, information security, and data analytics, as well as computer systems, databases, and networks.

A bachelor's in computer science trains undergraduates to develop computer software, write code in multiple programming languages, and solve computing problems. During a bachelor's program, students can specialize in areas like data analytics, software engineering, and information security.

In a nutshell, computer science degrees deal with the theoretical foundations of information and computation, taking a scientific and practical approach to computation and its applications.

In addition to the technical knowledge needed to pursue a career as a computer scientist, you will learn about the impact of technology on individuals, organizations, and society. 

A bachelor's degree in computer science meets entry-level requirements for many coding careers, including software development and information security analyst. Graduates with a computer science degree can pursue careers as computer and information research scientists, computer network architects, and computer system analysts.

If you have a lot of patience, an eye for detail, and enjoy work that requires a high level of precision, a computer science degree might be right for you.
fields.general_prerequisites:
KCSE Candidates:  Candidates must have obtained a minimum grade of C+ in the   following cluster subjects:  Cluster 1: Mathematics, Cluster 2: Physics, Cluster 3: Second Group II or Any Group III, Cluster 4: Any Group II/Group III/Group IV/Group V  
A-Level Candidates: Candidates with 2 principal passes, one of which must be in Mathematics or Physics, and a subsidiary pass with a Credit pass in Physics at 'O' level.  
Diploma in Computer Studies: Candidates with Ordinary Diploma in Computer Studies or equivalent with, a pass at Credit level, from an institution recognized by Senate.  
Higher Diploma in Computer Studies: Candidates with Higher Diploma in Computer Studies or equivalent from an institution recognized by Senate.  
Bachelor's Degree: Candidates with a Bachelor's degree from an institution recognized by the University Senate.

fields.course_name: Bachelor of Science (Computer Technology)
fields.course_objectives:
Bachelor of Science in Computer Technology program (BSCT) Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology(JKUAT) aims to:

help you gain an understanding of the principles and techniques involved in the analysis, design, implementation and maintenance of computer systems within a business environment.
produce graduates who are able to work in the computer technology and networking industry.
To equip students with knowledge and skills for modeling, analyzing, and synthesizing computations and computer systems.
To provide students with knowledge and skills for analyzing practical problems and developing viable computer-based solutions to them.
To train students on the practices and standards for ensuring professional, ethical, legal, secure, and responsible use of computer science.
To prepare students for participation in computer technology projects that require teamwork and/or collaboration.
To produce graduates who are capable of keeping abreast of, and adapting to, new developments in computer technology.
To prepare students for advanced learning and research in computer technology.
Foster innovation and creativity in the development of new technologies and software applications that address contemporary challenges in various sectors.
Encourage a deep understanding of data management, cybersecurity, and the ethical implications of emerging technologies in the digital world.
fields.course_general_info_and_about:
Bachelor of Science in Computer Technology program (BSCT) Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology(JKUAT) provides knowledge and skills in computer networking, electronics product design, computer circuits, and word processing. The goal of this Computer Technology program is to provide students with a high quality applications-oriented undergraduate education based on state-of-the-art technology as a preparation for productive employment in the broad field of microcomputer applications. This goal is achieved through continual updating of course content to ensure relevance to the latest industrial changes, supporting the development of appropriate computer facilities, promoting the integration of advanced computer technology in all courses, and encouraging professional growth and development of the faculty.

With computers assisting nearly every professional and leisure activity of modern life, people who can design, install, configure, network, and repair microcomputer systems can make a valuable contribution to business and industry. People familiar with both the hardware and software requirements of computers are especially valuable. Our Computer Technology students study the application of state-of-the-art components and software in contemporary computer systems. Students are given a solid foundation in mathematics, basic sciences, and electronics. A thorough study is made of digital circuits, microcomputer architecture and systems. Hardware, software, and firmware aspects of microcomputers are covered in detail.

Graduates of Computer Technology from JKUAT are qualified for immediate employment in a variety of industries as sales representatives, field specialists, interface designers, software specialists, and digital applications specialists.
fields.general_prerequisites:

Mathematics, Physical Science, Biological Science

KSCE Mean Grade of C+ and above, with at least a C+ in Mathematics and Physics/Physical Science, OR 
KACE with at least 2 Principles passes in Mathematics and Physics and 1 subsidiary pass, OR
Accredited Diploma in Computer Science /IT/ or related field with at least a credit pass from Commission for Higher Education accredited and validated institution.
KNEC Diploma holders in Computer studies with at least a credit pass and a mean grade of C at KCSE.

fields.course_name: Bachelor of Science (Information Systems)
fields.course_objectives:
Analyse a wide range of problems and provide solutions through suitable algorithms, structures, diagrams, and other appropriate methods.
Design and develop diverse computer systems.
Identify the current changes in computing technologies.
Evaluate and use professional techniques in developing processing information systems.
Venture into entrepreneurship and maintain highest professionals tandards in information and communication technology.
Demonstrate an in-depth understanding of database management systems and their role in managing and securing organizational data.
Employ project management skills to effectively lead and contribute to technology projects from concept to completion.
Critically assess the impact of emerging technologies on existing information systems and business processes.
Cultivate strong analytical skills to interpret complex data and transform it into actionable insights for business improvement.
Promote ethical considerations and data privacy principles in the development and management of information systems.
fields.course_general_info_and_about:
The Bachelor of Science in Information Systems program at KEMU University is meticulously designed to bridge the gap between business management and technical ICT expertise, effectively equipping students with a unique blend of skills. This comprehensive program not only imparts strong ICT technical skills but also enhances students' management abilities, along with developing their oral and written communication prowess. It's specifically tailored to address the demand for professionals who can understand both the technical and business aspects of information systems.

Graduates of this program gain a profound understanding of network technology and computing fundamentals, which are crucial for designing, developing, and supporting information systems. These systems play a pivotal role in resolving business challenges and bolstering business operations and managerial decision-making processes. A key focus of the program is on training students to not just manage existing systems but also to critically evaluate and optimize them for enhanced performance.

The curriculum at KEMU University covers a wide range of essential topics, including data structures for effective data storage and organization, database management for efficient data handling, network administration and construction, and information systems design. Additionally, the program delves into information resource management, electronic commerce, and various software applications, ensuring a well-rounded educational experience.

One of the program's strengths is its emphasis on problem recognition, analysis, and solution, equipping students with the ability to approach and solve real-world ICT issues. This is coupled with a solid foundation in key areas such as electronic commerce and software applications, providing graduates with the versatility to pursue diverse career paths in the rapidly evolving field of information systems.

Overall, the Bachelor of Science in Information Systems at KEMU University is an excellent choice for students seeking a career that combines technical ICT skills with business acumen. Its well-rounded approach prepares graduates to effectively tackle the challenges and seize the opportunities in the field of information systems, making them valuable assets in any organization.

OR

OR

K.C.S.E C+ (plus) or
C - (minus) with a Diploma (in Records & Achieves Management, ICT, Library studies, Logistics). In addition, the student must have obtained at least a C in English and a C in Mathematics or Physics.

fields.course_name: Bachelor of Arts (International Relations and Diplomacy, With IT)
fields.course_objectives:
The Bachelor of Arts International Relations and Diplomacy degree programme at Zetech University prepares the student for careers in business to work in International Relations & Diplomacy.
This programme will:
Equip graduates with sound knowledge of International Relations & Diplomacy as a field of study and practice
Produce undergraduates who have a deep knowledge of the subject as well as the ability to analyse any situation and draw out appropriate and relevant conclusions
Empower learners to establish and develop a viable and forceful link between theory/concepts and practice in the field for its proper implementation and utilisation by the students, scholars, policy-makers, and planners.
Prepare undergraduates and practitioners for further studies in the field of international relations & diplomacy.
Enable graduates to offer guidance on various policy propositions within Africa and beyond.
Upon graduating with a Bachelor of Arts International Relations and Diplomacy degree from Zetech University, the graduate will be able to:

Acquaint themselves with both theoretical and practical knowledge of key issues in International Relations and Diplomacy studies.
Communicate effectively both verbally and on-line on issues relating to International Relations and Diplomacy.
Effectively serve on national, regional and international sectors as International Relations and Diplomacy experts.
Apply theories of international relations to world foreign affairs and research.
Gain Knowledge to serve in both governmental and non-governmental institutions.
Equip students with both theoretical and practical knowledge of key issues in International Studies


ii) Prepare students to be critical thinkers and have an understanding and appreciation of International Studies


iii) Explore issues and trends in the development of international studies


iv) Ground students in the multidisciplinary perspective in international studies related social science disciplines


v) Enable students acquire skills necessary to critically evaluate and make positive contributions to international issues


vi) Prepare students with the necessary academic competence to pursue higher studies in International Studies -related disciplines
fields.course_general_info_and_about:
This Bachelor of Arts International Relations and Diplomacy degree programme at Zetech University offers training to equip students with the ability to address the emerging gaps within the discourse of International Relations & Diplomacy as a field of study that is valuable to understanding relations between the various actors in the international system.

This premier programme will empower learners to address not only the classical epistemological foundations of International Relations (IR) & Diplomacy as a discipline within the realms of Political Science but will fundamentally look at the contemporary and emerging sub-fields in the industry.

With the increase in internationalisation of the world, it is important that we have professionals trained in to fill the skills gap in the market.
The Bachelor of Arts degree in International Studies programme is structured and designed to ensure that students acquire an appreciation of the importance of international studies in the contemporary world. It is designed to prepare students for careers in governments and their institutions and, in non-governmental organizations, the private sector, international and regional institutions. Students will be exposed to debates in literature, research issues and developments in international studies. The programme is tailored to ensure that students possess an understanding of the complexity of international studies. The programme is unique and tailor made to suit emerging international developments. It is thus set to meet discipline and sector requirements. The programme is a response to demands from within and outside the country.
fields.general_prerequisites:
Holder of KCSE certificate with a minimum aggregate of C+
Minimum of C+ in English or Kiswahili and Either Geography, History, Social Studies, CRE, or Business Studies.

fields.course_name: Bachelor of Arts (Development Studies, With IT)
fields.course_objectives:
The process of development involves a structural change in the economy and society, leading to the enhancement of capabilities to meet human needs. This Bachelor of Arts in Development Studies programme aims to provide students with an understanding of development as a comprehensive process with several dimensions. The programme introduces students to some of the key debates and approaches among development specialists and analysts. 
Equip students with the analytical tools needed to understand the complex dynamics of global development, including economic, social, and environmental factors.
Encourage critical thinking about the challenges and opportunities associated with sustainable development.
Foster an understanding of the role of technology and innovation in driving development processes.
Prepare students for careers in international development organizations, government agencies, and non-governmental organizations.
Emphasize the importance of ethical and responsible approaches to development, recognizing the diverse needs and rights of communities worldwide.
Provide a foundation for advanced study in development-related fields, including policy analysis, program evaluation, and global governance.
Cultivate skills in research, project management, and effective communication, essential for professionals in the field of development studies.
fields.course_general_info_and_about:
The Bachelor of Arts in Development Studies program is an interdisciplinary course that provides a comprehensive understanding of the developmental challenges and opportunities facing nations globally. It delves into the political, cultural, geographical, and socio-economic evolution of countries, with a focus on understanding the complexities of both developing and developed nations. This program, which emerged in response to the unique challenges faced by postcolonial economies, now extends its analysis to include Western states, addressing contemporary and future societal issues through the lens of cultural and political development.

Central to this program is the emphasis on applying theoretical knowledge to real-world scenarios. Students are encouraged to engage in practical experiences such as internships, volunteering, pro-bono consulting, and even international placements. These hands-on opportunities are designed to enrich the academic learning experience, allowing students to apply classroom knowledge to actual development scenarios and challenges.

Upon graduation, individuals with a Bachelor of Arts in Development Studies are well-equipped for a range of influential and impactful careers. They can aspire to high-profile roles in government, driving policy and decision-making processes, or occupy senior positions in non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and charity entities, where they can make significant contributions to global development efforts. Local government roles also offer avenues for graduates to address income disparities and social inequalities through educational and community-based programs.

Moreover, the career prospects for graduates in this field are diverse and fulfilling. Potential career paths include policy analysis, ecotourism, diplomacy, immigration services, and aid work. The program equips graduates with the skills and knowledge necessary to navigate and contribute to various sectors that play a pivotal role in shaping and enhancing global and local development.
The program also integrates Information Technology (IT) into its curriculum, recognizing the vital role of digital technologies in analyzing and solving development issues in the modern world, thus equipping students with the necessary digital skills to effectively leverage technology in their future careers.
Students are trained to critically evaluate the impact of technology on development, preparing them for roles where they can influence technology-driven development strategies and contribute to sustainable and equitable growth in various communities.
fields.general_prerequisites:
K.C.S.E (Kenya Certificate of Secondary Education) mean grade of C+ or its equivalent.
Division two in O-level Certificate plus three years relevant work experience
A - level certificate or two principal passes of D plain.
A degree or a diploma from a recognized university or institution of higher learning.
Mean grade of C- (Minus) at KCSE and progressed from certificate to Diploma at any other recognized/accredited Institutions.

fields.course_name: Bachelor of Arts (Political Science, With IT)
fields.course_objectives:
The objectives of the programme are:


i) To understand and appreciate the role of politics in human life.


ii) To equip students with skills of understanding and conducting research on politics, political processes and political systems globally.


iii) To acquire appropriate skills that can enable students to effectively participate and contribute to political development in the country.
The goal of this program is to give students a strong foundation in political science and a clear understanding of how technology affects the political sphere in this day and age. The program equips students with skills and competencies to analyse and formulate political values, domestic policy issues, public policies, and foreign policies.
To equip students with skills of understanding and researching politics, political processes and political systems globally.
To understand and appreciate the role of politics in human life.
To acquire appropriate skills that can enable students to effectively participate and contribute to political development in the country.
To cover the greatest growth in the human aspect of life, politics and technology.
Develop critical thinking and analytical skills to evaluate political systems, public policies, and their impact on societies and individuals.
Provide insights into the intersection of technology and politics, especially in the context of digital governance, cybersecurity, and information dissemination.
Prepare students for careers in government, non-profit organizations, international relations, political consulting, and journalism.
Encourage engagement with contemporary political issues and debates, fostering informed and active citizenship.
Offer a multidisciplinary approach that combines political theory, comparative politics, international relations, and political economy with a strong emphasis on IT and its role in modern political practices.
fields.course_general_info_and_about:
Develop both theoretical and practical knowledge of key issues in Political Science in a rapidly changing technological world.
Systematically study, analyze and explain key political issues in the current technology age.
Acquire practical skills to enable them to serve with distinction as professionals in their chosen sub-specialty fields in political science.
Recommend solutions to some of the growing political issues and problems based on their application of the acquired knowledge.
Serve in different professional capacities in the private and public sectors as of various states around the world.
Research has shown that the teaching of political science and public administration can be irrelevant to the needs of development if care is not taken to incorporate all the aspects in this field, namely political science theory, international political economy, public administration, comparative politics and international relations. Moreover these four must relate to contemporary practice.

This programme is therefore expected to train graduates in the understanding of the political science and public administration discipline.. It takes cognisance of the comprehensive and relevant to the needs of development in Kenya and beyond. It is designed to provide theoretical, methodological and practical knowledge about man and governance.

Students graduating with specialization in Political Science and Public Administration are well equipped to work in government including; foreign service, state enterprises, managerial position in the private sector, non-governmental organizations, research institutions and policy think tanks, in which their knowledge of international organizations and relations will have an added advantage.
fields.general_prerequisites:
KCSE certificate with a minimum of an aggregate of C+ (plus) with a minimum of KCSE C+ (Plus) in English/Kiswahili
KCSE certificate with a minimum of an aggregate of C (plain) and KNEC Diploma or its equivalent from an accredited institution recognized by the University Senate.

fields.course_name: Bachelor of Education (Science, With IT)
fields.course_objectives:
The Bachelor of Education (Science) Degree Programme is intended to prepare teachers for secondary schools.  However, it is also suitable for people who are involved in educational management and training in tertiary institutions both in the public and private sectors.  In addition, some subject combinations provide competency in Research, Planning, and Management of science and technology institutions as well as technological research practices.  Students who go through the program can also become trainers in tertiary institutions as well as institutions of higher learning.

The curriculum for the BEd (Science) Programme is designed to provide adequate opportunities in both theory and practice of Education in order to train and produce qualified graduate teachers/Educators for the achievement of the national goals of Education and development.

The Programme will prepare students:

for an active and excellent career in all facets of the profession of Education.
to be active and competent in teaching two subjects at the secondary school level.
to be able to identify and develop the intellectual needs of the learner.
To gain the intellectual, professional and social characteristics that will enable them to become responsible leaders within the school and the community.
to contribute meaningfully to the national goals of Education and development.
to conduct training and carry out research in Education and in their areas of specialization and
for further Education and training in their areas of interest and specialization.
fields.course_general_info_and_about:
The Bachelor of Education (Science) program is designed to produce professionally qualified teachers who will be competent in teaching science subjects in Secondary Schools and middle-level colleges. The program has been developed in line with the requirements of the country’s secondary education system and the international standards on the graduate teacher training curriculum.

In the first year, students must take mathematics and chemistry, and any other (physics and botany/zoology) as content subjects.

In the second year of study, a student drops one of the content subjects and pursues the remaining two, one as a major and the other as a minor. The major subject is that which the student is expected to teach up to form four (IV) level of secondary school, and must therefore spend more time covering its content. For the minor subject, the student is normally taught up to form II level and the content coverage is, therefore, less and is normally completed by the end of the third year of study. The professional courses (methodology) for the two subjects are given equal.
Throughout the program, emphasis is placed on integrating IT skills with science teaching, ensuring that future educators are proficient in leveraging technology for effective science education. This includes training in the use of educational software, online resources, and digital tools that can enhance the learning experience in science classrooms.
The program also focuses on pedagogical skills and educational psychology, equipping future teachers with the necessary techniques to engage diverse learners effectively and foster a conducive learning environment. Special emphasis is given to innovative teaching methods, classroom management, and the adaptation of teaching styles to meet the needs of individual students.
In addition to core science and IT subjects, students are exposed to a wide range of electives and practical sessions, which include educational research, special needs education, and contemporary issues in science education. These electives provide an opportunity for students to tailor their education to their interests and the specific needs of their future teaching careers.
The program culminates with a teaching practicum, where students gain hands-on experience in real classroom settings under the supervision of experienced educators. This practicum is critical for applying theoretical knowledge in practical scenarios, helping students to transition smoothly into their roles as science educators upon graduation.
fields.general_prerequisites:
Mean grade C+ at KCSE or equivalent with at least C+ in any two (2) Arts subjects;
KACE or equivalent with at least two principal passes and a subsidiary
KCSE with a mean grade of C (Plain) or above and a Diplom in education with at least C+ in any two (2) teaching subjects.
P1 Grade trained primary school teacher with a mean grade C (plain) or above at KCSE with at least C+ in any two (2) teaching subjects.

fields.course_name: Bachelor of Education (Special Needs Education, With IT)
fields.course_objectives:
The Bachelor of Education (Special Needs Education) degree will produce teachers of high integrity and enable them to participate in the educational transformation process for individuals with special needs thereby contribute to nation-building.
Our schools need caring, well-prepared, and forward-looking special education teachers, as the quality of the bond between teachers and students is particularly important for the success of exceptional children. This program goes beyond best practices, prepares students to critically evaluate the literature on current and future practices.
The Bachelor of Education (Special Needs Education) degree program is designed to produce graduate teachers of high integrity who are well equipped with the requisite competencies and values of teaching special needs curriculum areas as prescribed in the secondary education curriculum in Kenya. Special Needs students require caring, well-prepared, and forward-looking special education teachers, as the quality of the bond between teachers and students is particularly important for their success. This program goes beyond best practices, prepares students to critically evaluate the literature on current and future practices.
Specifically, the program is planned in order to accomplish the following objectives:
to prepare the student for an active career in all aspects of the profession of education.
to provide a comprehensive training background necessary for the students to become competent experts in the profession of education.
to enable the student to identify the varied intellectual and special needs of the learner.
to develop the intellectual, professional, and social characteristics that will enable the student to become responsible leaders in their schools and the community.
to develop the scientific character and capabilities of dealing with issues and problems in education and society.
to provide the students a rich basis for interest in further training and education in their areas of expertise, ability, and interest.
fields.course_general_info_and_about:
The Bachelor of Education (Special Needs Education) programme prepares teachers to handle curriculum for the Hearing Impaired, Visually Impaired, and mentally and physically challenged persons.
Specifically, the BEd Special Needs Education programme been designed to respond to the emerging needs of providing skilled and competent teachers who can handle the Special Needs Curriculum in the secondary education system in Kenya.

Special Needs Education is a delivery system that is tailored to address the learning needs of students with exceptionalities that would not be adequately addressed through regular education. Public awareness and the current trends in the development of special needs education worldwide have created consciousness on the educational needs of students with disabilities and special educational needs. This has resulted in an increase in job opportunities for BEd Special Needs graduates in a wide array of roles such as teachers, quality assurance personnel, administrators, college lecturers and researchers in the area of special educational needs. 

The national need for special education teachers in Kenya is expected to grow faster than the average for all other occupations mainly because of the increased awareness amongst the general populace as well as government regulations. For instance, the Constitution of Kenya (Chapter 4, Article 54 1(b)) enjoins upon all the appropriate stakeholders to “Ensure access to educational institutions and facilities for persons with disabilities that are integrated into society to the extent compatible with the interests of the person.

This Bachelor of Education (Special Needs) programme seeks to ensure that every child with a disability has access to appropriate pre-school, primary, secondary and post-secondary level education. Individuals trained in Education with special needs will be able to work in public and private institutions of learning. Graduates can also pursue further studies and courses and advance to become supervisors or administrators or instructors in colleges that prepare others to teach special education.

Mean grade C+ (plus) at KCSE or equivalent with a minimum of C+ in the subjects of specialization. For those taking science course a minimum of C plain in in mathematics is a requirement. Or

fields.course_name: Bachelor of Education (Home Science, with IT)
fields.course_objectives:
To prepare teacher for an active career in all facets of professional Education.
To develop the intellectual, professional and social characteristics of teachers to enable them to become responsible leaders within the school and the community.
To develop the capacity of the teachers so that they should be able to
teach effectively at the secondary school, colleges and tertiary levels.
Identify research problems and design appropriate procedures for investigating and analysing them.
To provide a basis for science Education training that enables the teachers to pursue advanced training in both professional and academic areas.
Foster a comprehensive understanding of Home Science subjects, integrating practical skills and theoretical knowledge, essential for effective teaching.
Equip educators with IT skills and digital tools to enhance teaching methodologies and adapt to evolving educational environments.
Promote a holistic approach to education that encompasses physical, emotional, and social well-being, aligning with contemporary educational needs.
Encourage continuous professional development and lifelong learning, enabling educators to stay abreast of educational trends and best practices.
Cultivate a culture of research and innovation in Home Science education, encouraging educators to contribute to the field through scholarly work and curriculum development.
fields.course_general_info_and_about:
The Bachelor of Education (Science) programme prepares qualified science teachers for secondary schools, colleges and tertiary institutions. There is need to replace retiring teachers and fill the gap due to natural attrition. That the Secondary Education will be subsidised by the government, the increased enrolment will demand greater number of teachers. That is the more why this programme important.
 The Bachelor of Education (Home Science, with IT) program is an innovative and comprehensive course designed to prepare educators who are adept in teaching home science subjects in secondary schools, colleges, and tertiary institutions. Recognizing the evolving landscape of education and the growing demand for versatile teachers, this program integrates information technology with home science, ensuring that graduates are not only skilled in conventional teaching methods but are also proficient in integrating technology into their teaching practices.

This program addresses the urgent need to replace retiring educators and to cater to the increasing student enrollment in secondary education, especially since government subsidies are making secondary education more accessible. As a result, there's a heightened demand for well-trained and versatile teachers. The curriculum is structured to provide a deep understanding of home science subjects, including nutrition, family resource management, textiles, and child development, coupled with IT skills that are essential in the modern educational environment.

Students will engage in a variety of learning modules that cover both theoretical and practical aspects of home science and information technology. The program emphasizes the development of critical thinking, effective communication, and innovative teaching methodologies. It prepares educators to handle diverse learning environments and to meet the educational needs of students with different learning styles.

Graduates of this program will be well-equipped to inspire and educate the next generation of learners, contribute to curriculum development, and take on leadership roles in educational settings. They will be capable of not only filling the current gaps in the teaching workforce but also of elevating the standards of education in their respective institutions.

Additionally, the program offers opportunities for practical experience through internships and hands-on projects, which are crucial for developing real-world teaching skills. This blend of home science, IT, and educational pedagogy ensures that graduates are ready to face the challenges and rewards of a career in education, shaping the future of the field.
fields.general_prerequisites:
Minimum mean grade of C+ at KCSE level or its equivalent, 
A diploma holder from a recognized institution may be admitted to second year of study,
Minimum C+ in Home science and any other science subject.

fields.course_name: Bachelor of Education (Early Childhood Education, With IT)
fields.course_objectives:
The Bachelor of Education in Early Childhood Development program focuses on a holistic approach to child development and seeks to train early childhood teachers, educators, and administrators/leaders by providing them with relevant knowledge, skills, and attitudes capable of bringing about robust learning on the ever-emerging issues on children.

The main objective of this program is to produce graduates with the ability to identify and stimulate the development of creativity among young children.

Specific objectives of this program are;

To equip students with skills that will enable trainees to nurture children successfully.
To enable students to use diagnostic tools in the assessment of children with a view to making them become productive and useful members of society.
To equip students with knowledge and skills that will make trainees successful managers of Early Childhood Education institutions and programs.
Graduates of the Bachelors of Science in Early Childhood Development are able to:
Plan and implement developmentally appropriate lessons according to the state’s standards.
Demonstrate professional and ethical behavior in the classroom and in the field.
Use knowledge of child development to create healthy, respectful, supportive, and challenging learning environments for young children.
Develop and implement strategies to support and engage families and communities through respectful, reciprocal relationships.
Practice responsible assessment to promote positive outcomes for each child, including an awareness of assistive technology for children with ability differences.
fields.course_general_info_and_about:
Expanded Description for Bachelor of Education (Early Childhood Education, With IT):

The Bachelor of Education in Early Childhood Education, integrated with Information Technology, offers a transformative program for those aspiring to shape young minds during their most formative years. This program focuses on educating students from infancy to third grade, a critical period in a child's development. It emphasizes the nurturing of social, personal, and academic skills essential for children's ongoing educational journey.

The curriculum of this BEd degree in Early Childhood Education is meticulously crafted to provide an in-depth understanding of the developmental needs of early childhood. It combines foundational theories with practical application, ensuring that future educators are well-prepared to employ effective teaching methodologies tailored to young learners. The program emphasizes creating age-appropriate, engaging, and stimulating learning environments that cater to the diverse needs of children.

A unique aspect of this degree is the integration of IT, which prepares educators to leverage technology in enhancing the learning experience of young children. This approach is crucial in today's digital age, enabling teachers to utilize innovative tools and resources to foster a more interactive and effective learning environment.

Graduates of this program are not only skilled in identifying and fostering creativity and cognitive skills among young children but are also equipped with professional qualifications to handle the unique challenges of early childhood education. They are trained to support and guide young children through their critical formative years, laying a solid foundation for their future academic and personal development.

The demand for specialists in Early Childhood Education is growing, as there is an increasing recognition of the importance of professional expertise in the early stages of education. Graduates of this program have a wide range of career opportunities, including roles in child development centers, primary schools, educational consultancies, Non-Governmental Organizations focusing on child development, community-based educational projects, and nutrition and health centers.

Moreover, this program provides practical experiences through internships, workshops, and collaborative projects, ensuring that graduates are not only academically proficient but also practically skilled to take on real-world challenges in early childhood education settings. They are trained to be adaptable, innovative, and empathetic educators, ready to make a significant impact in the field of early childhood education.
fields.general_prerequisites:
Mean grade of C+ and above in Kenya Certificate of Secondary Education (KCSE) and C- in English.
Have at least one principal pass and 2 subsidiaries at KACE / EAACE.
Have a Diploma in Early Childhood Education from a recognized institution.

fields.course_name: Bachelor of Education (French, With IT)
fields.course_objectives:
To equip students with the knowledge of the French language that will enable them to operate, in French, in diverse academic and professional fields.


ii) To initiate students into the professions of translation and interpretation.


iii) With special reference to the material taught under the BA programme, to train students in rigorous and critical examination of phenomena, thereby prepare them for both academic and functional research.
Develop students' abilities to effectively communicate and teach the French language, incorporating IT tools and digital resources for enhanced learning experiences.
Foster an understanding of French culture, literature, and history to provide a well-rounded educational approach.
Prepare students for global engagement, with a focus on French-speaking regions, enhancing their intercultural competence and global awareness.
Encourage the use of technology in language instruction, ensuring students are well-versed in contemporary methods of language teaching and learning.
Equip students with pedagogical skills tailored to French language education, emphasizing innovative teaching strategies and classroom management.
Provide opportunities for students to engage in French language immersion experiences, enhancing their linguistic proficiency and cultural understanding.
Prepare graduates for diverse career opportunities in education, translation, international relations, and other fields where French language skills are valuable.
fields.course_general_info_and_about:
The Bachelor of Education in French with Information Technology is a progressive program designed to meet the growing demand for French language expertise in Kenya and the broader East African region. This demand is driven by the increasing prominence of Francophone countries as key players in international business, diplomacy, research, and education. With several East African Federation member countries being Francophone, proficiency in French has become an invaluable asset.

This program aims to produce well-rounded intellectuals proficient in the French language, its linguistics, and its rich literary traditions. Emphasizing a blend of theoretical knowledge and practical application, the course equips students with the skills needed to effectively communicate and operate in French-speaking environments. This comprehensive training covers various aspects of the French language, from basic communication skills to advanced literature and translation techniques.

Integrating Information Technology into the curriculum, the program ensures that graduates are well-versed in the latest digital tools and platforms, enhancing their ability to teach, translate, and disseminate information in the modern global context. This blend of language and technology prepares students to be innovative educators and communicators in the digital age.

Graduates of this program find themselves well-prepared for a variety of career paths. They can pursue opportunities in translation, interpretation, diplomatic service, academia, journalism, and the hospitality industry. The program's alignment with current job market trends ensures that graduates are not only employable but also competitive in these fields.

Moreover, the program has a unique focus on developing job creators, encouraging entrepreneurial thinking among its students. This aspect is crucial in today's economy, where innovation and self-employment are increasingly important.

For those aspiring to educate the next generation, the Bachelor of Education (French with IT) specialization is specifically tailored to train high school French teachers. This specialization equips future educators with the pedagogical skills and comprehensive language knowledge necessary to inspire and instruct high school students effectively.

In summary, the Bachelor of Education in French with IT is more than just a language program; it is a gateway to numerous opportunities in the international arena, combining linguistic proficiency with technological savvy to prepare graduates for the dynamic and interconnected world.
fields.general_prerequisites:
Applicants must satisfy minimum Maseno University admission requirements.

ii. In addition to the above, applicants must have obtained a grade C+ or above in French at KCSE level or its equivalent.

fields.course_name: Bachelor of Education (Music, With IT)
fields.course_objectives:
Appreciation of the various genres and styles of music.
Devel op a central  rol e for music in all  human endeavours
Nurture artistic creativity.
Provide a comprehensive understanding of music theory and history, integrating IT tools for advanced musical analysis and research.
Train students in various aspects of music technology, including digital audio production, composition, and editing.
Encourage the use of innovative teaching methods in music education, leveraging IT to enhance student engagement and learning outcomes.
Develop students' abilities to perform and interpret a wide range of musical pieces, fostering both individual talent and ensemble collaboration.
Equip students with the skills to critically analyze and critique musical works, fostering a deeper appreciation and understanding of musical art.
Prepare students to effectively organize and manage music-related events and projects, using IT for planning, promotion, and execution.
Promote an understanding of the role of music in society and culture, preparing students to contribute to the arts community and educational institutions.
Integrate technology effectively into music education, preparing graduates to teach music in a modern educational environment while embracing digital tools for creative and instructional purposes.
fields.course_general_info_and_about:
The Bachelor of Arts (Music) program takes cognisance of the importance of music in human society. Music is integral to
all facets of human activity and therefore deserves a central place in our curriculum. The program introduces students to
the theoretical issues in music, the different types of music and their evolution, as well as equipping them with skills
to compose and analyse Develop the skills to read and write different genres of music.
The program helps students develop specific skills in planning and delivering instruction in all types of music education classrooms. The curriculum emphasizes both the theoretical and practical elements of human behavior, musical and otherwise, and integrates with this core a variety of learning experiences that prepare the pre-service teacher for the classroom medium. Among these is a broad spectrum of learning experiences both at KU and in area classrooms. These include planning and delivering instruction, classroom management, conducting, assessment, and curriculum design. Within the curriculum, individual emphases are reflected in the choice of major performance medium and performance ensembles. The goal of the music education curriculum is to prepare the student for success in the profession.
The Department of Music and Dance, within the School of Creative Arts, Film & Media Studies, is the oldest university music department in the country and still continues to be the premier learning institution with regards to the education in music as well as music education. Currently the department offers Undergraduate degree programs in Bachelor of Music (BMus), Bachelor of Music Technology (BMus- Tech), and Bachelor of Education – Arts (Music) (offered through the School of Education). Together with these, the department offers Certificate in Music and Diploma in Music, which caters for those who are talented and participate in some music activity but missed the required cut-off marks in the Kenya Certificate of Secondary Education (KCSE) to join the university degree programs. However, upon successful progression from the Certificate and/or the Diploma programs, students are viable to join the degree programs. All these programs offer a wide range of musical experiences and knowledge while in a conducive academia environment. Students in the department have the opportunity to not only gain knowledge of music from theory to application, but also learn a western instrument, traditional Kenyan instrument and participate in traditional and modern/contemporary dances from Kenya and the region.
fields.general_prerequisites: Students must have attained a minimum of grade C+ at KCSE in music in addition to meeting the other general university admission requirements

fields.course_name: Bachelor of Education (Arts, With IT)
fields.course_objectives:
The BEd Arts programme seeks to produce graduate teachers who will have the requisite knowledge, skills and values relevant to not only be competent in the skills of delivery but also be specialized in their areas of interest, ability and aspirations.

to prepare the student for an active career in all aspects of the profession of education.
to provide a comprehensive training background necessary for the students to become competent experts in the profession of education.
to enable the student identify the varied intellectual and special needs of the learner.
to develop the intellectual, professional and social characteristics that will enable the student to become responsible leaders in their schools and the community.
to provide the students a rich basis for interest in further training and education in their areas of expertise, ability and interest.
Foster a deep understanding of educational theories and practices, integrating IT tools for enhanced teaching and learning experiences.
Equip students with effective classroom management skills and the ability to adapt teaching methods to diverse learning environments and student needs.

fields.course_general_info_and_about:
The meticulously designed Bachelor of Education Arts degree program is a transformative journey, shaping graduate teachers into individuals equipped with essential competencies and values vital for teaching specific subject areas. Aligned seamlessly with the secondary education curriculum in Kenya, the program's development closely adheres to the stringent requirements of the country's secondary education system. This ensures that graduates not only meet but exceed both national and international standards for teacher training, establishing a benchmark for excellence.

This comprehensive BEd Arts program extends beyond the traditional realm of teaching, offering a broader horizon of possibilities. It stands as an excellent choice for individuals involved in educational management and training, whether within tertiary institutions in the public or private sectors. The program's versatility further unfolds with specific subject combinations providing students with competencies in Economic Planning, Business and Financial Management, and Accounting Practices. Graduates, thus, emerge not only as adept secondary school educators but also as individuals poised to become influential trainers in tertiary institutions and higher learning establishments.

The strategic integration of Information Technology (IT) into the curriculum elevates the program's richness, preparing educators to harness technological advancements in their teaching methodologies. In a world where technology plays a pivotal role in education, graduates from this program not only master traditional teaching methods but also demonstrate proficiency in integrating modern technological tools into their pedagogical practices. This dynamic intersection of education and technology ensures that graduates are not just prepared for the contemporary educational landscape but are well-positioned to thrive in the evolving dynamics of 21st-century education.

The program's commitment to innovation is further emphasized through continuous updates and adaptations to incorporate the latest trends and advancements in both education and technology. Students benefit from exposure to cutting-edge teaching strategies, ensuring that they are well-equipped to address the evolving needs of students in an ever-changing educational landscape. Through a blend of theoretical foundations and hands-on practical experiences, graduates are not only knowledgeable educators but also transformative leaders ready to shape the future of education. This holistic approach, combined with the infusion of IT, prepares graduates to navigate the complexities of modern classrooms, fostering an environment where learning is dynamic, engaging, and technologically enriched.

The inclusion of IT components in the curriculum goes beyond just a supplementary aspect; it becomes an integral part of the educational philosophy. Graduates are not merely users of technology but become adept facilitators of digital learning environments, seamlessly integrating IT tools to enhance the learning experience. This unique blend of traditional teaching methodologies and modern technological integration positions graduates as trailblazers in the educational field, ready to lead classrooms into the digital age.

In addition to subject-specific expertise, the program places a strong emphasis on fostering critical thinking, creativity, and adaptability among graduates. These attributes are considered essential for educators to effectively navigate the complexities of the modern world and instill these skills in their students. The program's commitment to holistic development ensures that graduates are not only proficient in their subject matter but also well-rounded individuals capable of making meaningful contributions to the broader educational community.

Furthermore, the inclusion of IT components serves as a catalyst for cultivating a culture of continuous professional development among educators. Graduates are not only equipped with the skills needed for today's educational landscape but are also empowered with the mindset and tools to stay abreast of emerging trends and innovations. This commitment to lifelong learning positions graduates as dynamic educators who can adapt to the evolving needs of students and the educational field.

As part of its forward-looking approach, the program fosters a collaborative and inclusive learning environment. Students engage in projects, workshops, and collaborative initiatives that promote teamwork and communication skills. This collaborative spirit is extended to the integration of IT, where graduates are encouraged to explore innovative ways to leverage technology for collaborative learning experiences. This prepares them not only to excel as individual educators but also as contributors to a global educational community that thrives on shared knowledge and experiences.

In conclusion, the Bachelor of Education Arts program, enriched with IT components, is a comprehensive and forward-thinking initiative that prepares graduates for the multifaceted demands of modern education. By combining traditional teaching methodologies with cutting-edge technological integration, the program creates educators who are not just proficient in their subject matter but are also equipped with the skills, mindset, and adaptability needed to shape the future of education. fields.general_prerequisites:
